title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream through the tragic story of Jay Gatsby and his obsessive love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Explores themes of racial injustice and loss of innocence through the eyes of Scout Finch in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian regime where surveillance and thought control dictate every aspect of life.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Centers on the spirited Elizabeth Bennet and her turbulent relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Follows Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to take revenge on the white whale Moby Dick.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Narrates the experiences of Holden Caulfield, a cynical teenager navigating the complexities of adolescence.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a magical quest to reclaim a lost dwarven kingdom from a fearsome dragon.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Depicts a society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: Follows Jane's growth to adulthood and her love for the brooding Mr. Rochester, uncovering dark secrets at Thornfield Hall.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: An intense tale of love and revenge revolving around Heathcliff and Catherine on the windswept Yorkshire moors.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society driven by technological advancements, social conditioning, and enforced happiness.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Explores morality, guilt, and redemption through the experiences of the impoverished ex-student Raskolnikov.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: Examines love, family, and social dynamics within Russian society through the tragic story of Anna Karenina.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: Victor Frankenstein creates a monstrous being, leading to catastrophic consequences and moral dilemmas.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A classic horror tale featuring the infamous vampire Count Dracula and his pursuit of victims in Victorian England.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: Odysseus' perilous journey home after the Trojan War, filled with mythological adventures.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: An epic portrayal of injustice, heroism, and redemption in 19th-century France.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd's mystical journey seeking treasure and discovering personal legend and self-realization.
